Package gw.api.contact

Interface ClaimContactRoleOwner

All Superinterfaces:
com.guidewire.cc.domain.contact.EntityContactRoleOwner
All Known Subinterfaces:
BaggageIncident, Claim, com.guidewire.cc.domain.claim.ClaimContactRoleOwner, ClaimContactRoleOwner, DwellingIncident, Evaluation, Exposure, FixedPropertyIncident, Incident, InjuryIncident, LivingExpensesIncident, Matter, MobilePropertyIncident, Negotiation, OtherStructureIncident, Policy, PropertyContentsIncident, PropertyIncident, TripIncident, VehicleIncident
All Known Implementing Classes:
APDIncident, BaggageIncident, Claim, DwellingIncident, Evaluation, Exposure, FixedPropertyIncident, Incident, InjuryIncident, LivingExpensesIncident, Matter, MobilePropertyIncident, Negotiation, OtherStructureIncident, Policy, PropertyContentsIncident, PropertyIncident, TripIncident, VehicleIncident
public interface ClaimContactRoleOwner extends com.guidewire.cc.domain.contact.EntityContactRoleOwner
Interface for entities that can "own" ClaimContactRoles. Marking an entity as a ClaimContactRoleOwner means that it can be associated with ContactRoles. In practical terms, this means the entity will get ContactRole-based accessors that can then be used as items in NVVs. This gives a customers a way to add arbitrary Contacts to an entity, and have those roles appear in Parties Involved.

    Methods inherited from interface com.guidewire.cc.domain.contact.EntityContactRoleOwner

    setContactByRole

  • Method Details

    • addRole

      ClaimContactRole addRole(ContactRole role, Contact contact)
      Adds a role with the specified contact to this entity. This method should only be used with Required or ZeroToMore roles. For Exclusive roles, just set the property with the name of the role. Does nothing if the Contact already has the role.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the role is exclusive or prohibited, or the Contact is null or not of the right type for the given role. For exclusive roles, use EntityContactRoleOwner.setContactByRole(ContactRole, Contact) instead.

    • addEmptyRole

      ClaimContactRole addEmptyRole(ContactRole role)
      Adds an empty ClaimContactRole to this owner. It is assumed that the Contact associated with the role will be filled in later. The role must be Required or ZeroToMore.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the role is prohibited or exclusive

    • removeRole

      void removeRole(ClaimContactRole claimContactRole)
      Removes the given ClaimContactRole from this owner.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if this is not the owner of the given ClaimContactRole.

    • getClaim

      Claim getClaim()
      Returns the claim value.

    • getContactTypes

      List<IEntityType> getContactTypes(ContactRole role)
      Gets the Contact classes for the given role. If the role has a contact subtype constraint, returns that subtype. If there are ExceptionConstraints then all valid subtypes will be returned (note, this only includes the types specified in the constraints -- any subtypes of those types are implicitly valid.) Otherwise returns [Contact.class].
